Napoli have confirmed that goalkeeper David Ospina has returned home from hospital after being given the all-clear.

Ospina spent the night in hospital after he collapsed during Napoli’s 4-2 win against Udinese on Sunday, but tests subsequently confirmed the Arsenal loanee did not sustain any lasting head injuries.

“David Ospina was discharged this afternoon from Pineta Grande Hospital, where he was taken last night for a series of assessments and specialist visits,” read an official statement.


“All the tests came up negative. The visits ruled out any problems. The diagnosis was that of a vasovagal syncope, which was resolved within a few hours.

“The player was advised to take a few days off and will not be called up by Colombia.”

Napoli could be without Dries Mertens for Wednesday’s Serie A trip to Empoli with a leg injury.

Mertens was replaced an hour into Napoli’s 4-1 win at Roma on Sunday, and the club confirmed on their official website that the forward needed treatment for ‘a bruised tibia’.

Consequently, he could be spared for the match at Empoli ahead of next week’s Europa League quarter-final first leg against Arsenal.


Full-back Elseid Hysaj also received treatment, but the Partenopei insist he went off at the Olimpico for ‘precautionary reasons’.

The southerners are already without Lorenzo Insigne, Amadou Diawara and Vlad Chiriches.

Napoli pair Dries Mertens and Elseid Hysaj have been passed fit to face Empoli in Serie A on Wednesday.

Mertens and Hysaj both pulled up during Napoli’s 4-1 win at Roma on Sunday, but they have come through their respective treatments.

Piotr Zielinski is also back from suspension, but Lorenzo Insigne, Amadou Diawara, Raul Albiol, Vlad Chiriches, Faouzi Ghoulam and David Ospina all remain sidelined.


Napoli squad to face Empoli: Meret, Karnezis, D’Andrea; Malcuit, Koulibaly, Hysaj, Luperto, Maksimovic, Mario Rui, Zedadka; Allan, Zielinski, Fabian; Verdi, Callejon, Ounas, Mertens, Younes, Milik, Gaetano

Carlo Ancelotti has confirmed that Jose Callejon will stay at Napoli, describing the winger as a ‘very important’ part of his team.

Callejon joined Napoli in the summer of 2013, as part of Coach Rafa Benitez’s rebuilding of the squad, and has scored four goals in 40 games for the Azzurri this season.

His contract has only another year to run, but Ancelotti made it clear the Spaniard was going nowhere.


“He will stay because he’s expressed a desire to stay, he is happy here,” said the Coach in the third and final part of his pre-Arsenal Press conference.

“We have had talks, there is willingness from the club and I to continue our journey with him.

“He has a great sense of belonging in the side and he is very important here. He is one of the keys to our success. When he wears this jersey, he feels something special.”

Napoli Coach Carlo Ancelotti claims there are no conditions for a team like Ajax to emerge in Italian football. “The fans always ask for results.”

Ajax eliminated Juventus from the Champions League quarter-finals on Tuesday but while Ancelotti was full of praise for the Dutch side, he admitted supporters of Serie A clubs were too impatient to see their teams nurture young players.

“Ajax play very good football, but no-one would have guessed that they would have made the semi-finals,” he continued at his Press conference for Thursday’s Europa League quarter-final against Arsenal.


“I don’t think they will win the Champions League, but maybe I’m wrong. They play proactive football, defend individually and profit from one-on-ones. They look to play combinations and are very good at it.”

The 59-year-old was then asked if top players were needed to be successful.

“You need technique and training,” he replied.

“We’ve all been pleasantly impressed by this Ajax side. They’re a team who have always produced great players.

“However, long-term planning is not allowed in Italy because the fans always ask for results.”

Napoli ultras threw Jose Callejon’s shirt back at him amid tense scenes, as they continued their protest despite a 2-0 win at Frosinone.

The victory at the Stadio Benito Stirpe put them eight points clear of third-placed Inter, but it was not enough to calm the ultras protest against the club and President Aurelio De Laurentiis.

A series of large banners appeared around the city of Naples on Saturday night and Sunday morning, all reading the same message: “Carletto the latest chosen one to take the fans for a ride with no real project.”


Although around 2,500 travelled to Frosinone – near Rome – for the game, they included the players in their protest at failure to progress in Europe or the Coppa Italia.

When Callejon went to throw his jersey into the crowd at the final whistle, it was thrown right back at him.

As the supporters chanted ‘We deserve more’ the players walked off to the locker room, but Dries Mertens stayed behind to ask what was happening.

It was particularly galling for Callejon, as this was his 300th game in a Napoli jersey.

“I am surprised. You can’t ask for more from these players in terms of effort and professionalism,” said Carlo Ancelotti in his Press conference.

“The project continues and we can only take one step at a time. If the fans want players who earn €10m per year, that won’t happen, but we could bring in talented players who can make the difference. I don’t understand all this negativity.”

Raul Albiol has thanked Napoli for ‘six unforgettable years’ after joining Villarreal and promises to come back to celebrate if they win the Scudetto.

Albiol completed his transfer to Villarreal on Thursday after a six-year spell at Napoli that yielded a Coppa Italia and Supercoppa but no Serie A title.

“These have been six incredible years. I thank all the fans for the support they gave me,” the defender told Radio Kiss Kiss.

“Only the Scudetto dream was missing, but I hope it comes true eventually. Napoli have a great future. They have a great team, with a great Coach. Hopefully we’ll win something soon.

“Certainly next season it’ll be a two-horse fight with Juventus for the Scudetto. As for Sarri at Juve, nothing is taken for granted in football.

“There have been so many players who have moved between teams who hate each other.

“It doesn’t surprise me. Everyone must be able to make their own decisions, and they must be respected.”

The 33-year-old was then asked about the his replacement Kostas Manolas and a potential deal for James Rodriguez.

“Each new player must keep the level high so Napoli can be competitive on several fronts.

“It was difficult to leave Napoli and change clubs because of the great affection of the fans. These have been six unforgettable years.

“If the Scudetto arrives, I’ll come back to celebrate. Napoli deserve it because they’re on the right track.

“Fabian has his head screwed on. He has everything to become a world-class player. He’ll give lots to Napoli in the future.

“Thank you very much to the whole city of Naples, which has given me affection. I salute and thank the whole club, the President De Laurentiis and my teammates.

“You’ll have one more fan in Spain.”

根據英國《每日郵報》報道，拿玻里主帥安察洛堤正相中國際米蘭鋒霸伊卡迪，並打算動用當家前鋒恩薜利，再加上5400萬鎊的轉會費，向國際米蘭作出報價，勢要搶得心頭好。


據報道，拿玻里已認定阿根廷鋒將伊卡迪為未來的領軍旗手，已準備好向國際米蘭提交這份難以拒絕的報價。在干地上任後，伊卡迪已不在這名前車路士教頭的計劃中。干地著重的，是球員的紀律先於球員的能力，近年伊卡迪在國際米蘭牽起了不少風波，因此干地並不想阿根廷人擾亂更衣室的秩序，只要報價合理，便會出售這名26歲球員。國際米蘭在今夏勢要追逐曼聯前鋒盧卡古，並會為此子提供7500萬鎊的報價，伊卡迪的離開也可為盧卡古籌集轉會資金。

Napoli have reportedly made Zlatan Ibrahimovic an offer, but the LA Galaxy striker is demanding €5m over 18 months.

Napoli President Aurelio De Laurentiis confirmed yesterday that he wanted to sign Ibrahimovic in January.

Now, Gazzetta dello Sport is reporting the 38-year-old wants a contract that takes him through to the summer of 2021, worth a total of €5m.


The newspaper adds the Partenopei are “studying the situation” but are only prepared to offer him €1.5m until the end of the season, with the option of extending for a further campaign for €3m, at this stage.

With that in mind, the issues of bonuses and image rights could play a key role in the Swede coming to the San Paolo.

The former Juventus, Inter and Milan hitman is due to become a free agent in December, when his contract with the Galaxy expires.

拿玻里鬧兵變！該支意大利南部球會在官方Twitter發表聲明，反對球員發起罷操行動，並表明堅決維護球隊的權力，包括以發動法律訴訟的形式解決問題。此外，球隊主教練安察洛堤（Carlo Ancelotti）有傳會因為風波離開球隊。

有報道指，拿玻里的球員發起罷操離場。會方的聲明表示：「鑒於球員們昨天（2019年11月5日）的行為，我們將在法律層面上維護我們在經濟、資本、形象和紀律等層面的權益。我們早前也已經委託主教練安察洛堤，由他來全權負責球隊訓練的事宜。在可預見的將來，會方不會再向媒體發表聲明。」班主迪羅倫迪斯（Aurelio De Laurentiis）在當地時間週三早上與安帥展開為時達一小時的會議，討論球員罷訓危機，而所有球員和安帥均已離開拿玻里訓練場。


拿玻里聲明所指的「罷操」，是指球員拒絕迪羅倫迪斯的懲罰性加操。事緣拿玻里位列意甲第7，既先後賽和史帕爾和阿特蘭大，又不敵羅馬。迪羅倫迪斯對球隊近日的表現不滿，宣布對球隊進行懲罰式集訓，為期一週。不過，安察洛堤和全體球員均對有關措施表示不滿。在對薩爾斯堡紅牛賽前，安帥更向記者表明有關懲罰沒有必要。賽後，安帥和球員均拒絕出席歐洲足協安排的官方記者會，他們更沒有搭乘大巴前往迪羅倫迪斯安排的訓練營，而是各自使用自己的交通工具回家。有消息指，會方故意在聲明把帶領操練的責任推卸給安察洛堤，而安帥有可能在今天之內宣布離隊。有熟悉相關法規的律師向意大利傳媒表示，涉事球員或被扣5%的薪酬，以作懲罰。

有關罷操行動由隊長恩斯尼（Lorenzo Insigne）所發起。在對薩爾斯堡紅牛賽後，恩斯尼向班主兒子Edoardo（球會副主席）揚言不服從加操決定。《共和報》（La Repubblica）指，迪羅倫迪斯聞訊後大為震怒。

Allan was thought to have been hit the hardest after his clash with Vice-President Edo De Laurentiis following the 1-1 draw with RB Salzburg, being ordered to pay €200,000 - which amounted to 50 percent of his monthly salary.

The club captain has not travelled to Anfield for tomorrow’s Champions League match against Liverpool, officially due to an elbow injury.

FIFPro have announced they are helping Napoli players avoid “further abuse and intimidation by the Serie A club” after their heavy fines, which were imposed "without valid grounds."

The players were docked part of their October salary, up to 50 per cent in some cases, for refusing to go back into a training retreat.

A meeting with President Aurelio De Laurentiis had seemed to clear the air, but this morning FIFPro – the union of world football players – announced it was helping them fight the fines with the Italian Players’ Association.


“Napoli’s intention to withhold player salaries is without valid grounds and is being contested collectively,” read a statement.

“FIFPro believes that the ad-hoc decision of Napoli forbidding players to go home and re-join their families, following the match against RB Salzburg, was unjustified.

“Like every other employee, professional football players have the right to ensure that their private life is respected, especially considering the already congested fixture list which sees many players away from home for prolonged periods.

“The grounds on which Napoli seeks the application of fines, for the players’ refusal to follow the unreasonable instructions of Napoli, contradict provisions in Italy’s collective bargaining agreement.

“The players of Napoli cannot be subjected to arbitrary decisions of a disenchanted club when the result of a match is unsatisfactory.


“We echo the sentiments of FIFPro member, Associazione Italiana Calciatori (AIC), in that Carlo Ancelotti and his technical staff are ultimately responsible for managing the playing group however they deem fit.

“Technical matters are not the responsibility of club directors and we support Ancelotti and the players of Napoli for their united stand in clearly difficult times.

“FIFPro is standing by ready to assist, in close co-operation with AIC, to ensure the players are not subjected to further abuse and intimidation.”
